creditline: Gift of Ms. Sheryl R. Johnson, wife of artist Paul Lamantia
description: busy, colorful layered image rendered in multicolored pigments; green flooring with linear square pattern along bottom edge of image; red and purple creature, with two legs on the floor, each foot containing smaller legs and a red mouth extended downward with jagged teeth in LRC; several layered pieces of paper added to creature, one of which is a long had with two protruding eyes, and three slender, jagged openings in pink pigment; circular shape in URC resembling a planet in URC; orange and red long squiggly shape, with slender, curving protrusions in top right; upside down rising staircase in gold and peach pigment in top center; long neon green shape in center left of image; neon pink shape with orange linear pattern in LCQ; gaping purple mouth with red interior and sharp white teeth in ULQ; yellow creature in the shape of a squared-off arch, with three curving legs, long nose, oval mouth and a single eye on forehead in bottom left edge
inscription: on front, in bottom right edge, in black ink: 10 {circled} 30 1/2 x 41 | on back, in bottom center, in black ink: 24 {circled} | on back, in bottom center, in black ink, MIXED MEDIUM | COLLAGE | W 31 1/2 x H 42 1/8 | \"CRIME ALLEY\"
medium: Gouache, black ink marker, graphite, and collage on paper
provenance: The artist, Chicago; Sheryl R. Johnson, Chicago (wife of the artist); given to MIA, 2018.
signed: on back, in bottom center, in black ink: PAUL LAMANTIA | 1969 {circled}
title: Crime Alley
